etymology.description: 𠂤 (“mound, hill”) + 帀 (“to surround”); simplified by replacing 𠂤 with 刂.
etymology.interpretation: A hill combined with the idea of encircling evokes troops camped around a rise, yielding the sense of an army and, by extension, a master/teacher who leads or trains. The simplified form keeps the encampment idea while swapping the hill for the knife component, leaving the core meaning intact.
etymology.simplification: 𠂤 was replaced with 刂 to reduce strokes, paralleling the simplification 帅 ← 帥; a graphic streamlining without phonetic or semantic reanalysis.

examples.chinese: 她是我的中文老师(她是我的中文老師)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì wǒ de Zhōngwén lǎoshī.

examples.chinese: 我向师傅请教(我向師傅請教)。
examples.english: I seek advice from the master.

examples.chinese: 第三师明天换防(第三師明天換防)。
examples.english: The 3rd division will rotate duty tomorrow.
